[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The UK Fishing Vessel's Electronic Logbook and Submission System (ELSS) defines requirements for EU reporting compliance..
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ELSS captures, validates, and transmits logbook data with role-based access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ELSS automates data capture, validation, and reporting for the UK Fisheries Administration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ELSS integrates with onboard systems, databases, and APIs for logbook operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ELSS provides a GUI with role-based access for vessel masters and agents.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ELSS supports maritime hardware such as GPS and weighing systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ELSS is compatible with XML/XSD schemas for ERS integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ELSS uses secure protocols like PGP and SFTP.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ELSS handles large-scale logbook data efficiently.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ELSS ensures 24/7 system availability for compliance reporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ELSS is configurable for workflows, including multi-vessel operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ELSS connects with regulatory services for compliance reporting.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ELSS is designed for vessel masters, agents, and regulatory authorities.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ELSS requires internet connectivity and compliant onboard hardware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ELSS assumes access to UK XML/XSD standards and ERS systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: ERS: Electronic Reporting System mandated by EU regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with ERS for data validation and reporting.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall interface with onboard GPS and weighing systems for automatic data capture.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow vessel masters to capture, validate, correct, and transmit logbook data (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate formatted XML/XSD data for transmission to UK Fisheries ERS systems (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive user interface with role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall include help documentation and training modules for users.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process logbook entries within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall process data concurrently for multiple vessels.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store logbook data in a secure, encrypted database (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall ensure data integrity and prevent unauthorized modifications (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with Council Regulation (EC) No. 1966/2006 and Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1077/2008.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions for auditing and generate error notifications for failed transmissions.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with EU and UK fisheries data standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall support modular deployment for vessel-specific configurations.

[SEC] 5. References: Council Regulation, Commission Regulation, and UK Fisheries guidelines.
